item.title: 2nd Generation Senolytic Drug Derived from Navitoclax Shows Promising Results for Osteoarthritis and IPF
item.description: A 2nd generation senolytical drug derived from navitoclax has shown promising results in treating osteoarthritis and idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF), according to a new study conducted by researchers at the University of Birmingham in the UK. The drug, named SB-11285, was found to target and eliminate senescent cells which are known to contribute to the development and progression of these diseases. Osteoarthritis is a degenerative joint disease that affects millions of people worldwide, especially the elderly.
